comments.body:
this game needs new bossessss and gearssss

i hope they listen to us

Applies to above ^^^^ (Only because I ran out of character usage)

Side note: I am not trying to suggest things straight from the Localized Weather & Storm Fronts mod.

1. The weather should be localized instead of the entire world experiencing the same weather.

2. There can also be a radar to see what we're about to experience. (Radius: 500-1000 blocks from Radar Block)

3. (Only if tornadoes and/or hurricanes get added) there can be a tornado siren.
Yes please! i want that for years now!

I agree at these, I love to see a haunted and Enchanted forest biomes in the game, to spice things up and give some fantasy stuff in the game instead of just everything be something from our world all the time, so yeah

I think the Biome is a good idea. The auto-smelting would probably be way to OP but I think the idea of a place where witches (or Illusioners) are supposedly modifying creatures is a cool addition to the lore.
The trees will drop dirt when broken.

With the upcoming updates, I would propose that the game gets more interesting structures to explore and find. For example one could find a lone broken tower on some tall mountain, an old fort now infested with mobs (e.g: spawners) in a forest, an abandoned farmhouse with some distended fields around it, a nicer/updated mineshaft with a proper entrance, or a natural grove with a pond and some magical feature - which could be explored for brewing or other items- or could be home to some new creature like peaceful plant-lings (or the glare or moobloom); a old mechanical workshop/forge to find a rare copper golem... The ideas are literally endless to making structures, but when it comes to current Overworld building features, there aren't many, and the ones we have are old or repetetive. Having a more "lived in - yet abandoned" feeling for minecraft would make exploration way more interesting, and add to the lore of being the lone survivor who shapes the world to his or her whim.
Hope we can do something about diamonds in the Nether and Iron in the Nether

It is possible to get to the Overworld, by trading with Piglins and looking through chests for obsidian.  It takes a very long time, however.  Perhaps ruined Nether portals should be added in the Nether, as well.  This would make for a neat hardcore challenge.  With commands you should also be able to set a dimension of the world spawn.
I've done survival in the Nether all you do is trade with piglins for obsidian and fire charges. But still has my vote if its in bedrock.
I can't get into multi-labels.
Learn to write.
That‚Äôs a cool idea what do you think about sunken desert pyramids I posted that
If Icicles were to be added, they should definitely generate on mountains to make them more dangerous
Parrots should also sit on the new illagers' shoulders. Maybe to designate a captain.
nah i think we have enough illagers as of now, because of the illusionists and iceologers eventually getting added, maybe a skeleton variant instead

YES SWAMP SAPLINGS

 YESSSSSSSSSSSS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
This dimension should have tall jungle-like trees, where they hang upside down and hop from canopy to canopy
The trees could also have vines that grow up, allowing you to make it to the ground, which is above you (void is below)

The ground should have hanging grass that, when you come in contact with, gives the player an animation of them putting their hands up to grab it. They would then be able to walk with their hands on the grass. The grass doesn't cover the entire ground, so you would have to find patches/paths to follow
There should be plants that you can eat or make potions out of that would make it so you float up and/or you see the world as upside down

There should be creatures that look like they are hanging from their hands as well, but when the screen is upside down you see that their arms are actually their legs. They may have really tall shoulders, or they could have antlers/antennas that look like arms and legs. Basically, I want a mob that looks like a different but similar creature when upside down, kind of like the pictures that show an old man one way and a young woman when held upside down

There should be a bunch of structures that resemble stalactites, with possible stalactites hanging from them. The inside should have a bunch of staircases that go in every direction, like in relativity paintings. There could even be doors that change a mobs direction when they enter, allowing them to use the different staircases

The stalactite structures could have spiral staircases on the outside of them. They could drip liquid like normal stalactites, making it the only thing that naturally falls down. This liquid/object could be obtained and used to turn you upside down
The mobs should say things like "Grumm," kind of like an in game hint that naming a mob this will turn them upside down. You could say that they grumble

The upside down mobs could be bug-like. When viewed normally, they would look like people hanging from their hands, but when viewed upside down their "arms" would be their legs and their "legs" would be antennae
Also, having bug-like mobs could result in them being able to walk on all surfaces, making this not just be upside down

The name of this dimension may sound similar to "turv," like "topsy-turvy." The grass/blocks may be called turvf, like turv + turf. The dimension could be called the Turverse (okay, it sounds kinda dumb, but it's all I got so far)

Players may be able to get items and abilities from this dimension that would enable them to climb walls and ceilings. Personally, I think a climbing enchantment for a pickaxe would be cool, but there could also be potions and mobs
If this dimension does have sideways things rather than just upside down things, it could be where vertical/sideways slabs are introduced
It would be cool if palindromes were involved somehow. The mobs could say palindromes, or maybe say things in reverse. Grumm -> Mmurg

The portal could have upside down frames. You may have to jump into it or it may slowly pull you up (it would make interesting features). It would be interesting if it pulls you up when you enter and then pushes you out (still up) when you exit

The portal could be multidirectional, meaning that if it is buildable (rather than being generated) it could be built in any orientation. Still, it could be generated in different directions, with the ruins it is found in being in different directions as well
It could be called the Turniverse, but I fell like that's a bit on the nose

I mentioned Doors that change a mobs direction. They could also be like gateway blocks where they teleport to other blocks whilst displaying the other side of the doorway. They could also be used to make infinite stairways and such
The doors/portals could look a bit like mirrors
Redstone components could be found there such as things that reverse a redstone level, or dampen redstone signals
There could be ways to place things that are dependent on the block below them underneath blocks (like upside down redstone)

What if it was just like the overworld?

But upside down
The hanging grass blocks may be connected to a falling block that only falls once a player pulls on the grass
I think the void should be the only danger, an passive mobs and npcs should spawn
Exists already.
what does?
Great idea, adds a sense of quest
A mushroom sheep might look like this:
what would it be called though? all the other mushroom mobs currently have cool names (mooshroom, cluckshroom, etc)
It's a Musheep. Or a Mushram. Or, a Plushroom, Fluffshroom, Mycelamb, Myceliram, Mysheepium, etc
The Mushroom Sheep should have Mushrooms growing on its back like Mooshrooms

And the only way to get a brown one is the same way you get a brown mooshroom, strike it with lightning. And that what I just said sounded like I was gonna murder it but as long as it‚Äôs full health it‚Äôs fine! üçÑüêë
I Like Sheep And I Like Mushrooms So I am Voting for this
I Like Sheep And I Like Mushrooms So I am Voting for this
Cool, but I dislike the rotten meat and salt idea. It would probably just be really annoying, it is already hard enough to find enough food. Other than that great submission!

What a great idea! I do like the idea of the lagoons and flamingos and salty water, but how would you get red algae? The salt and rotting meat would probably just annoy a lot of people, although maybe rather than getting salt from the furnace, you could get red algae? Maybe through a crafting table. Would love to see more tropical environments ingame!

407025962972 yea I was trying to find a reason for them to add salt into the game and that‚Äôs the only logical thing that came to mind at the time... if you have any other ideas for a use for salt then plz comment I‚Äôd love to read your thoughts

404864498832 The red algae would grow there naturally and would also grow in the oceans as well. If you have any suggestions for alternate uses for salt then leave a comment, would love to hear your ideas.

This sounds cool! What exactly would it look like? I imagine it's shape something like the columns on the main end island but wider, with biomes on top and different biomes far below. I would love to see a new dimension, and I think this one sounds great!

all of these sound fun! And what ways will we have to avoid Heat damage (similar to how leather avoids Freezing damage)

I think there could be creative things to fill that purpose.
cool maybe splattered slime on the walls
Pleas vote for this post if you believe in what I'm saying so Mojang can see this

I actually ran out of space. On the quartz i was going to mention that perhaps it could be colored by dye to make more decor blocks that are translucent but less so than glass.

Also there should be a more white and less tan sandstone block to better match the real life pillars

Also i was going to mention a few animals you could add. Since we don't have many birds i would suggest a red pheasant that spawns higher up in the biome along with macaques. In the lower part I'd suggest the Giant Salamander which as a bonus is critically endangered as it is being farmed for its meat in china.

I think that's all I have for this biome, thank you for listening. I know i am long winded but a biome should have a lot to it. Have a great one

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: ‚ÄúCave villages‚Äù

Text: ‚ÄúThe new Caves and Cliffs update is coming and everyone is excited. I have a little idea. And villages under the earth. As you saw in the trailer, there will be giant caves in the future, which are also very spacious and also have water, and this is exactly where caves should be villages. How does the idea sound?‚Äù

- Translated by Admin
This will be one of The best ideas and a Change for The Minecraft 1.18 caves and cliffs I will Like it
I Hope it will come in the 1.18

This biome should have large islands at a variety of elevations, and obsidian pillars should in some cases connect islands that are partially above eachother. Perhaps there would also be the odd horizontal spike.
There could be a new ore here similar to Netherite in the spikes, but rarer.
any end biome suggestion is a suggestion i want , i want this end update soo baddd
I think this would be great considering the devs want to keep The End Dimension's "desolate feel"

Hmm, a good idea but what else would be there? What kind of mobs? If there's no real reason to go there then why would we even bother?? People, like me, are lazy by nature. Unless we have unique blocks, mobs, and biomes to keep our attention occupied we won't bother. Just look at a screenshot, because obsidian is annoying as heck to mine.

Not saying I hate this idea. I would just like it fleshed out a bit more. I actually really really like this idea. Minecraft needs more dimensions and to reinstall that sense of adventure back into us. The Nether update is good, but I think great ideas like THIS need to be brought to the game. You got a vote from me pal~!
The picture used is a concept of what the biome would look like it. It was used from a scrapped biome of the same name from the Biomes O' Plenty Mod.
Maybe there could be a chance of finding a new ore: aquamarine, aquamarine could be used to get higher value items from piglins
Yes, I agree with you, Aquamarine can spawn here. But I think it can be used for more the just currency.
